meanings.definition: A bitter crystalline alkaloid used to treat malaria.
meanings.sent1: The doctor prescribed quininas to cure the patient's malaria.
meanings.sent2: She took quininas every day to fight off the malaria infection.
meanings.sent3: The bitter taste of quininas made the patient grimace but helped in treating the illness.
meanings.sent4: Like a warrior, quininas battled against the malaria parasites in the patient's body.
meanings.sent5: The effectiveness of quininas in treating malaria made it a valuable medicine.

meanings.definition: A group of compounds derived from cinchona bark.
meanings.sent1: Scientists studied the properties of quininas found in cinchona bark.
meanings.sent2: The quininas extracted from cinchona bark were used in the production of medicine.
meanings.sent3: The group of compounds known as quininas played a crucial role in traditional medicine.
meanings.sent4: The essence of cinchona bark's quininas added a unique touch to the medication.
meanings.sent5: The discovery of quininas in cinchona bark revolutionized malaria treatment.

meanings.definition: A medication used to prevent and treat malaria.
meanings.sent1: The nurse administered quininas to the children to protect them from malaria.
meanings.sent2: Quininas proved to be an effective medication in combating malaria outbreaks.
meanings.sent3: The village celebrated the arrival of quininas as a shield against malaria.
meanings.sent4: In the battle against malaria, quininas emerged as a powerful weapon.
meanings.sent5: The community relied on quininas to keep malaria at bay during the rainy season.
